I open the website http://www.pentax.de/de/Foto-Service-Downloads.php#MediaTypeID4. On the left side of the website a part of the last viewes tab is displayed. Please see the attaches screenshot.

comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text: Does it happen on all Pentax pages, e.g. when you click some of the navigation links?
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text: Does it happen on all Pentax pages, e.g. when you click some of the navigation links?

That's exacting my problem... I see the very same.

I bet http://www.pentax.de/site/images/IS/contentcol1-bg.gif it's a 2 colors paletted Gif
comments.author: vampipe@yahoo.com
comments.text:
That's exacting my problem... I see the very same.

I bet http://www.pentax.de/site/images/IS/contentcol1-bg.gif it's a 2 colors paletted Gif
comments.creator: vampipe@yahoo.com

comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text:
I wonder why anybody uses such images for a solid color area. Can't they use CSS background-color? I would understand it for some patterned backgrounds...
bz, can we consider this bug confirmed too? It may even be a duplicate.
But this user reports Mac OS 10.6 and FF8. Any idea?
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text:
I wonder why anybody uses such images for a solid color area. Can't they use CSS background-color? I would understand it for some patterned backgrounds...
bz, can we consider this bug confirmed too? It may even be a duplicate.
But this user reports Mac OS 10.6 and FF8. Any idea?

comments.text:
> bz, can we consider this bug confirmed too? 

Sure, what the heck.

> But this user reports Mac OS 10.6 and FF8. Any idea?

Nope.  Worksforme on 10.6....
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text:
> bz, can we consider this bug confirmed too?

comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text:
Confirmed by the author of bug 689962 of which this may be a duplicate.

Pipe, could you read the description here and all the settings the reporter posted. Can you see something your system has in common with his one? Like graphics card?
comments.raw_text:
Confirmed by the author of bug 689962 of which this may be a duplicate.

Pipe, could you read the description here and all the settings the reporter posted. Can you see something your system has in common with his one? Like graphics card?

comments.text:
(In reply to aceman from comment #1)
> Does it happen on all Pentax pages, e.g. when you click some of the
> navigation links?

OK, I clicked around. It happens on all pages exept the start page: http://www.pentax.de/de/foto.php
comments.author: info@wildwater.de
comments.creator: info@wildwater.de
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to aceman from comment #1)
> Does it happen on all Pentax pages, e.g. when you click some of the
> navigation links?

OK, I clicked around. It happens on all pages exept the start page: http://www.pentax.de/de/foto.php

comments.text: Good, that one seems to not contain the supposedly problematic background image http://www.pentax.de/site/images/IS/contentcol1-bg.gif .
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text: Good, that one seems to not contain the supposedly problematic background image http://www.pentax.de/site/images/IS/contentcol1-bg.gif .
Can you confirm if this is still an issue on latest nightly? I can't reproduce this locally on OS X 10.7

comments.text: Can you confirm if this is still an issue on latest nightly? I can't reproduce this locally on OS X 10.7
